channel.title: STALKER_Log
channel.generator: Webpage HTML Export plugin for Obsidian

item.title: 20240719 - Rostok Route
item.description:
#Journal #ExpeditionLog

#Journal #ExpeditionLog


Proceeded to Rostok with Walter Shenoski





Walter Shenoski and I were going to head to Rostok (LITZ), he had some stuff to sell and I needed to learn the route. We were joined by another random Life In the Zone/Factions/Loner Factions/Loner we found at Rookie Village (GOC). He was a little strange and monotone and at the time we didn't realise what would happen next. Turns out the guy was Monolith (LITZ), they were after me. Turns out I am Most Wanted.
We made our way to North Farm to stop off during the dark. While there, the random Loner turned on us. Attacked and tried to rob us. I surrendered but Walter Shenoski ended up killing the guy, but his gear got wrecked. We laughed it off and headed further North.

WARNING Radiation / Pseudodog
We headed north through the Military checkpoint and on the road north, we were attacked by a Pseuddog. We had to run due to being close to the Bandits (LITZ).

We went east and circled around to avoid going North past the Bandits (LITZ) HQ in the Train Yard. I went loud by accident after we were attacked by BlindDogs. We had to run as fast as we could.

We stopped off at Flea Market (LITZ), there were two Stash's, one in the basement and one in the roof.

We headed North, attacked by a few dogs. It was close to an Emission and we made a run for it. Hiding in the bunker just outside the entrance.

Unfortunatly that was where it all went bad. We headed inside and were immedietly jumped by a pair of Monolith (LITZ). Walter Shenoski was killed for chatting shit and I was let go. The guy at the start had been in contact with his brothers.
I went inside and met a Duty (LITZ) guy. He had been jumped by them too, managing to kill the one he'd seen.

I made a return run for Cordon (LITZ), only getting into trouble with a dog but otherwise, made it back nice and safe.


Monolith tried to assassinate me. Found out later I was a HVT on their list, because I helped people.

item.title: 20240720 - Darkscape Firestation
item.description:
#Journal #ExpeditionLog

#Journal #ExpeditionLog


Proceeded East to Darkscape via Cordon Factory




Warning Radiation / Izlom / Zombie.
Blue Stash in main building (May contain weapons)

Warning BlindDogs Pack

Was taken down by the Pseudodog. Had to return to get my kit

Stash
Returned back to base


"Died" and had to return for kit. Not gone any further.

item.title: 20240721 - Swamp Interim
item.description:
#Journal #ExpeditionLog

#Journal #ExpeditionLog






Heading North West from Rookie Village (GOC), I headed along the path that I used to take towards Swamp (LITZ). Careful of any mutants.
Spotted the tower and the small caravan. Radiation close to the water south of it but safe place for safety during an emission if on the way to the Swamp.
Found a Stash on the highest point of the tower, on the support.

Heading along the path, I spotted the ruins through my binocs and noted zombies in the vacinity. I was careful for radiation and had been careful for mutants on the way but was attacked by a Pseudodog. It damaged my kit and I would have to replace my eyepatch again. I need to go to Rostok (LITZ) to go get a bunch.
Killed the dog and the zombies, looted and found a Stash in one of the buildings. Contains Blue Stash with rifle inside.

I headed into the camp, finding radiation, I searched the buildings; there was a lot of waterproof bags. Was attacked by BlindDogs.

Small camp on theh ill between watered ruin camp and bus station. Stash there.
On the approach, there was radiation Note, Stay on the bridge and head straight North to the station next time. Was attacked by 4x Boar when an Emission started. Took cover in the bus station. Found a [[Stash].]

Going north from the bus station, I entered the first building and immedietly heared a strange noise, I spotted a Bloodsucker and fucked right off. Saw some loot but not much.

Hole in a fence across from Mark 1 fence. Able to cross to Northern approach and onto rail.

item.title: 20240831 - Yantar
item.description:
#Journal #ExpeditionLog

#Journal #ExpeditionLog


Travelled to Rostok with Brother Atlas, met Bulldog and then went to Yantar for Licenses, before returning back.

1 - The Church of the Tree to Flea Market (LITZ)
2 - Flea Market (LITZ) to Rostok (LITZ)
3 - Rostok (LITZ) to Yantar (LITZ)
4 - Yantar (LITZ) to Flea Market (LITZ)
5 - Flea Market (LITZ) to Cordon (LITZ)

item.title: 01 - Log
item.description:
The Guide entered the Zone with no memory, but a clear intention. To help people. He had been here before, done this all before but everytime he seems to be back at the start
Robbed by the Military upon entering, The Guide was helped by a few Loners to get a starting kit.
Running into the Outlaw Network, The Guide made friends easily and became a prospect. All went relatively well, until that fateful night.
Guiding some new blood around the Zone, they were attacked in Farm. The Guide was shot in the head, left for dead, he managed to survive and recover, well enough. Now he goes around, 7.62x39 lodged in his brain. Yet still helping the STALKERS of the Zone.
Monolith Capture

item.title: Summary
item.description:
Stashes contain items left by other stalkers.




Up ladder in building next to The Bunker (LITZ)
Under tree east of road into Rookie Village (GOC), next to a body of a Stalker
Under Bridge in middle of Cordon (LITZ)
Up tower next to bridge


Tower close to Cordon. Up tower and on highest support
Irraded Ruins. Blue Stash (Weapon once) Warning Radiation / Zombie / Pseudodog
Bus Station
Displaced Village Warning Bloodsucker



Flea Market (LITZ), 2x. One in the basement and one in the roof.
Military Checkpoint One stash North of Cordon (LITZ), South of Garbage (LITZ)

item.title: Jobs (GOC)
item.description:
#GOC

#GOC




One of our boys lost a nice hat to some boars. Go kill 8 of those things for us.
Reward: 4,000

Someone needs to go to the Wild Territory and get a proper reading of the max millisieverts.
Reward: 5,000

The Scientists need 4 pictures of Electro anomalies.
Reward: 6,500

We need a solid reading on from the road just south of Rostok. Find the center and get an accurate reading of its peak.
Reward: 5,000

Ecologists always need more information on the zone. Go and photograph 2 different Acid Puddles
Reward: 6,000


Pseudodogs are among the most annoying little shits we have to deal with. Go and kill 6 of the little shits for us.
Reward: 11,000

Duty needs someone to make a stash for us near the Ecologist FOB (GOC). Obviously put it out of the way but give us the coordinates so we can use it properly
Reward: 9,000

We need intel on a select target. Speak with the Major for more info.
Reward: 9,000

Bloodsuckers are some seriously ugly fuckers. Do us a favor and take out some of them. 4 should do nicely.
Reward: 10,000


Wanna prove yourself? Need someone to head north and kill us 3 Chimera (GOC). Take a photo with the kill and bring us the Claws.
Reward: 40,000

Duty needs someone to make us a stash near the Skadovsk (GOC). Speak with the Major for more Details
Reward: 19,000

Duty has more enemies than we like to admit sometimes. Speak to the Major about dealing with some of them.
Reward: 25,000-45,000

Need someone escorted to the designated location. Provide safe passage to the destination. Speak with the Major for details.
Reward: 36,000

We need some work done and now. Shit ton of Bloodsuckers are in an area we need cleared. Speak with the Major for Details.
Reward: 40,000

Monolith Hunt
A dead Fanatic is the only good fanatic. Speak with the Major for more details on the job.
Reward: 60,000
===============
If you are turning in a bounty dead you must take a picture of the corpse and bring the dog tags as proof.
If you are bringing them in Alive make sure a Duty soldier is present to take them.
Bounty: Grim
Reward: 115,000
Dead or Alive

item.title: 0. Introduction To The Guide
item.guid: Life In the Zone/The Guide's Guide/0. Introduction To The Guide.md

item.title: Introduction
item.description:
The Military Checkpoint from the direction of Rookie Village


Rookie Village from the direction of Sidorovich (LITZ)'s Bunker

A Stash within the Hunting Shack

The grave of a Lost Stalker


Location of a fishing rod, up the ladder and by the chimney

A Chicken coop with a chicken.

The Guide's Bunker alongside a fire, a water fountain and a stash up the ladder in the attic.


Descend the stairs and turn left.

The door to the man himself, a donation barrel for items.

The Man himself.

The Exit to Sid's Bunker from Sid's point of view.




Resting inside the ruined building, a Quest Giver. Within the fire place is a good set of military boots that can hold a boot knife.


Road to the mill as from Rookie

A Construction yard just off the left of the road, with a stash within,

A Stash, dogs spawn around here and a good place to stand on the concrete blocks via the stash box.

The Factory from the bridge

The Bridge, a truck underneath.

The Bus Stop, a good place to hide out against dogs.


The ruined bridge.

Two stashes. One just in front of the upturned tanker and one in the tower.
item.guid: Life In the Zone/The Guide's Guide/1. Welcome to the Cordon.md

item.title: Anomaly Training
item.guid: Life In the Zone/The Guide's Guide/Anomaly Training.md

item.title: Building
item.description:
Double Doors

Fence

2x Wooden logs
18x Planks (5x Wooden logs)
36x Nails

Splitting Axe

Shovel

Pickaxe

Hammer

Hatchet

Hacksaw

Handsaw
Note: You will need one or the other of the Shovel and Pickaxe. The handsaw and hacksaw can be used to saw or make planks.
Crafting
The basic Kits:
a wooden pallet + 5 Planks:

Table Kit
Cabinet Kit
Bed Kit
Sofa Kit
Box Kit
Special Kit
Furniture Kits have multiple "pallet slots". Depending on how many pallets you put into your kit, you can place different Things.
Table Kit
1 Pallet = Small table. --- 2 Pallets = Medium table. --- 3 Pallets = Large table.
Bed Kit
3 Pallets = Small bed. --- 4 Pallets = Large bed.
Sofa Kit
!! BUGGED !!
2 Pallets = Small sofa. --- 3 Pallets = Medium sofa. --- 4 Pallets = Large sofa.
Cabinet Kit
1 Pallet = Pallet Shelf (for up to 3 wooden crates). 2 Pallets = Gun Cabinet. --- 3 Pallets = Medium Cabinet. --- 4 Pallets = Large Cabinet.
Old Wooden Crate (required for the Medium Cabinet):
10 Planks + 16 Nails
Special Kit
2 Pallets = Trashcan. --- 3 Pallets = Workbench. --- 5 Pallets = Greenhouse. --- 4 Fabric = Log Storage Place
Box Kit
Instead of slots for pallets, you need to put pallet frames in this Kit (max 4). The more frames you use, the bigger is the box you can place.
A Frame requires 4 Planks and 24 Nails
Stove Kit
combine a empty barrel + a Hacksaw.
Fill the material Slot of the Kit (10 Metal Sheets) to place the Stove.
Rain Collector Kit
combine a wooden pallet + 4 Metal Sheets.
Fill the material Slot of the Kit (4 fabric) to place the Rain Collector.
CRAFTING ON THE WORKBENCH:
Old Fridge
10 metal plates, 1 metal wire and an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hands: Screwdriver
Currently the fridge doesn't need to be powered (may change in future updates) but will increase the hold time of food. By default food will hold 3 times longer - but this may vary because it is configurable.
Repairbench
10 metal plates, 10 wooden planks and 30 nails.
Tool in your Hands: Screwdriver
The repairbench acts as a repair booster. Add repairkits to the repairbench and take the damaged item in your hands to use the bench.
The repairbench repairs faster, can repair to pristine and your attached repairkits will last longer.
Small Spotlight
1 metal plate, 1 metal wire and 25% of an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hand: Screwdriver
This small Spotlight can be powered by a 9V Battery and can be placed on the Ground.
It also works in artificial darkness areas like bunkers.
Desk Lamp
1 metal plate, 3 wooden planks and 25% of an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hand: Screwdriver
You can change the position of the lamps head. The desk lamp will also work in artificial darkness.
Floor Lamp
a metal pipe, 1 metal wire, 2 wooden planks and 25% of an electronic repair kit
Tool in your Hand: Screwdriver
The floor lamp needs to be powered from external sources - like a generator or a truck battery with wire.
It's an all-around light and therefore is disabled to work in artificial darkness for performance reasons.
Solar Panel
10 metal plates, 1 metal wire and an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hand: Blowtorch
The solarpanel requires a truck battery to work. It needs to be turned on to charge the battery at daytime.
Firewood Storage Place
4 metal plates
Tool in your Hand: Blowtorch
A small storage place for firewood, wooden sticks and other stuff to make a cozy fire.
Coffee Machine
10 metal plates, 1 metal wire and an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hand: Blowtorch
A cool retro coffee machine to make you a cup of coffee. Add a bag of coffee beans and fill the machine with water. Doesn't need to be powered (may change in future updates)

item.title: Note 01 - The Guide Assistance
item.description:
New to the Zone? Lost and hungry? The Guide is here to help. Get top-tier assistance, food, and supplies tailored for STALKERs. Your journey is my mission. Safe travels, every step of the way.
Work Offered includes:

Artefact Hunting Training & Collection
Mutant Hunting Training & Collection
Destination Guide
Package and Letter Delivery
Basic and Advanced Medical Treatment – Wounded? Sick? Need patching up? The Guide can help.
Medical Survival Lessons – Learn how to treat wounds, recognize anomalies' effects, and survive injuries in the field.
Seek The Guide at Hotel Pripyat at the Farm in Cordon, North of Rookie Or usually somewhere in Cordon. He is often found in a hooded trench coat or an old Soviet jacket and wears an eyepatch.
Signed,
The Guide

item.title: Life in the Zone Server
item.description:
The Guide (LITZ)

-The Guide (GOC)
-0. Journal (GOC)


Refuge (GOC)


Sidorovich (GOC)
Barkeep (GOC)
Ecologist (GOC)
Duty Private (GOC)
Public Freedom (GOC)
